review_text: Poor cleaning and very forgetful

Went to celebrate my mother’s birthday. Initially excited because room was beautiful and spacious. Quickly became a problem with stressed barking dog in the room next door. We checked in at 4:30, dog didn’t stop barking until 11:30 when the owners came home. The front desk offered to  move us, but we needed an accessible room and there were no other available. Front desk said they couldn’t do anything about the dog until midnight and then they could call the police. Absolutely awful. And then, to find out the room charge through hotels.com was double the price of what I would have paid booking through Marriott… ugh… done.
Everything was clean, quick check in and easy access!

Was disappointed, found room nice but, bathroom floor looked like washed with dirty water, ac extremely noisy and fridge never got cold. Every time went by front desk staff in conversation and i did choose not to wait and complain
Beautiful hotel, great location.
Great property. Kids loved the pool. Nice lobby area and beds were comfortable.
Very pleasant environment
Incredible just incredible
Nice smaller hotel.  Great spot
Great walking, shopping, dining

Excellent property luxurious spotless with great service.  Bellman and check in with Darlene went smoothly.  One small problem.  We asked to extend our stay one day.  They agreed and said the price would be the same.  The next day the bill was $200 more.  I spoke with the manager and he immediately corrected the bill and to apologize gave us a breakfast coupon.  Beautifully handled and much appreciated.  Great hotel with lots to do in the area.
Great stay!
The location is awesome
bad bed
Beautiful hotel with lots of shopping close
I know this hotel is new. Everything was so nice and fresh. Loved first walking in and it smelled so nice. Every thing was clean and neat. Our room was nice as well. Definitely will stay there again.
Had everything you could possibly need
It was nice

Con I

Convenie 








e
Property located in a very vibrant area with shops, restaurants and a beer garden. Hotel staff was amazing and room was very clean and we definitely will be back.
Front desk staff was very accommodating. Quick and easy check in. Pool area was beautiful and relaxing. Room was beautiful
Always a great stay!

Modern and clean hotel with a good restaurant, coffee cafe, and rooftop bar in the hotel. Very nice outdoor pool and hot tub. Spa available but didn’t book anything. Great shopping area outside the hotel. Only complaint is we stayed for 2 nights and housekeeping didn’t clean our room after the first night. We had to request fresh towels, more bottled water, bed was never made up, etc. For the nightly price, the room should be made up daily.
Great restaurants and shopping all walking distance. Nice staff too.

Great atmosphere for a girls trip, we did a cooking class at the Tuscan kitchen. Craft cocktails and the appetizers in the rooftop bar were delicious. We thoroughly enjoyed dinner at the Tuscan market. The hotel is clean, very comfortable beds. It was a great getaway all around.
It was a great stay for the most part but the room was a not properly cleaned as we did find a child’s toy under our bed.

Absolutely fabulous! We live in MA but wanted to get away for the night to a hotel with a pool. Hands down, this hotel is beautiful. Drinks by the pool and everything is within walking distance for a good time. The rooftop bar has a dj on the weekends. You will not be disappointed.

We were a large group with many rooms, yet the staff at The Artisan made each of us feel like their most important guest. From check-in to housekeeping to rooftop bar to fitness center, the team was professional, efficient, and warm. The location was perfect for a get-away with nearby shopping and many restaurant options within walking distance.
It was really beautiful property and a great weekend getaway.
Great potential. Nice area and nice hotel but their are a lot of kinks. Housekeeping is terrible. Pool is packed with people not staying at hotel.
Excellent! Clean, staff was amazing.
Excelente
Nice clean hotel with great amenities
My first time stay and is wonderful excellent service and i return back
The hotel was beautiful!!
Great location with many restaurant options

Everything was clean and all members of the team were helpful and professional, though the TV in our room was broken (and apparently couldn’t be fixed by tech support). Additionally, the $15 to park overnight seems underhanded - there’s plenty of space and this should be free to all guests
We enjoyed our stay
Clean comfy rooms. Rooftop bar fun and delicious appetizers.  Arrived for the 3 pm check in room was not ready but wasn’t too long a wait.  Fifth floor corner room nice and quiet with nice views
This hotel is located in a very walkable area with lots of shopping' dining and entertainment options.
Beautiful urban property - many dining options, walkable to shopping, and enjoyable activities. The pool is outdoors so not accessible during the off season.
Endroit intéressant avec beaucoup de restaurant et  boutiques. Dans l’hôtel pas vraiment de restaurant pour le déjeuner seulement un café snack.
A gem in southern New Hampshire.
The parking. Not enough.
First time guest.  Have been very pleased with my experience at the Artisan.  Would stay here again and recommend to friends.
Everything was very nice

Place was beautiful and the rooms were large and spacious. Great location, everything conveniently located at your fingertips if you need something. My only complaint was the $15 fee to pay for parking.  Parking should be complimentary especially since it’s not cheap to stay here and we had 3 vehicles so it was an $45 extra. Fitness center was very nice also.
Top notch!
Fantastic room, very comfortable, with obvious attention to detail.
Hotel was great
Clean, modern, and has more features than most hotels.
Beautiful hotel and great location. The decor is amazing.  The staff were extremely friendly.  We absolutely loved our stay.
Great overall stay.
Fabulous!

This place was absolutely amazing. I mean EVERYTHING about it… from the hotel, the Sam Adam’s outdoor bar, the food, the shops, the entertainment, the pool (unfortunately it was closed we went off season), but it looks beautiful. I can’t wait to stay here again. Tuscan market is the best! I’m so in love with this property, everything is right at your fingertips. Hands down one of my favorite places to stay.
Excellent!
Love, love staying here!

The hotel is very beautiful and chic. We loved the Tuscan Kitchen bar, as well as the rooftop bar. It is surrounded by many great dining options. The bar tenders were friendly, and the hotel hostess Darlene was great, very friendly, and accomodating. We'll definitely be back again, and we higlhy recommend this property.

The hotel has a great location.  We had a very comfortable room although the heating was a little loud.  The biggest disappointment was the cafe.  I ordered a very hot latte, well they tried 3 times but just couldn’t do it.  The pastries were not fresh, although they swear they were made fresh daily. All this trouble and everything is overpriced.  A hotel of the calibre should beef up their quality to go along with the high prices.
Extra large TV
We were there for New Year’s Eve, and it was lovely! Everything is extremely modern and clean, we are very impressed. We watched the fire works right from our room!
Very friendly staff, Very clean room, food options outstanding !
The hotel was clean and exceeded my expectations. Great for shopping and the restaurants didn’t disappoint! Would definitely stay here again.
Great stay, beautiful room and facility with lots to do!

Absolutely stunning property! Beautiful! 
Thank you
Absolutely amazing! Will definitely come back.
Beautiful hotel
Great location for our stay.  Local shopping and restaurants right in the Tuscan Village area.  Area nicely decorated for the holidays.  Enjoyed our stay and will return.
Everything was good
The hotel is beautiful, modern, feels like a resort!
Like area for shopping. Didn’t like front desk assistance

My booking never existed apparently thanks to hotels.com. This website over booked the hotel. There were many other people in the same situation, having traveled several hours to be told there was no reservation. The hotel compensated my stay and was lovely to deal with but hotels.com told me there was nothing they could do.

Nice property in a fun location.  It was loud downstairs and if your room is on the top floor near rooftop, be prepared for noise.  Heard people running down hallways.  Housekeeping service was sub par.  Did not have any linens for pullout, asked for them, they brought but acted annoyed.  Also didn’t have enough towels, asked for more but they never brought them. They had a wedding party with a late check out that I think impacted everyone checking in.  Some grumpy people in the check-in area waiting. Maybe our experience was abnormal.
Very nice hotel, we checked in around 6pm, numerous made carts in our hall, had trouble getting to our room, lobby was very noisy
Beautiful property and beautiful rooms!! Close to shop to so much!
Very nice hotel, very clean, fancy, rooftop, bar, cafe. Right in the middle of a cute village and next to a mall

The room was clean and modern. The bed was very comfortable! The walk in shower was very roomy and relaxing. The staff were very pleasant. The attached restaurant was incredible.The location of the hotel was excellent with a wide variety of shops right outside the front door. Everything felt very curated and upscale. I will definitely stay here again.
Very nice overall
We were issued an ADA compliant room which we did not request, and it was not comfortable at all
Beautiful hotel enjoyed our stay !
New, clean boutique hotel. Rooftop restaurant very good.
Beautiful hotel with an amazing area around it. Easy walking to shops, dining and a fabulous outside space with seating and fire pits. Incredible experience.

Went for a weekend trip. Spot is absolutely beautiful.  Perfect for before the holiday - lights music and amazing views of the area.  The hotel was beautiful.  Only downfall was how loud the doors slam shut for each individual room. One night it was a lot of slamming doors- not by anyone’s fault just the way the doors are designed.  Just something to be mindful of when staying here.  Otherwise hotel was perfect.

We stay at this hotel for the weekend. When we got there on Friday, they allowed us to check in early, which was very nice. The hotel is decorated for Christmas and looks absolutely beautiful.


We’re on the second floor, right above the entrance. The hotel was pretty quiet with an occasional late night, drunk person from the wedding downstairs yelling. The rooms really nice, had perfect lighting and was very clean. The only thing I didn’t like about it was that they had shampoo, conditioner, and lotion that was a men’s musk smell. I did like that. They had bar soap from one of the stores downstairs though.


You can’t beat the location. It’s across the street from the Rockingham mall which is filled with stores and walkable. There are so many options for eating and shopping in the plaza where the hotel is, you don’t have to drive anywhere.


We will definitely be staying here next time we go up north to visit.

This hotel was nothing special. The staff was very friendly and it was clean. But we were told we were getting a VIP upgrade and we did not. We didn’t complain or say anything because we were only there for one night. The bed wasn’t very comfortable, neither were the blankets or pillows. And the elevator was broken so for a busy Saturday night it was a long wait getting and from. I wouldn’t stay again.
Place was emaculant and  like bo other place i stayed

Very comfortable, clean and great customer service. Cool area in general, hotel is very close to so many attractions. Doors were heavy, comforting in the feeling of security. They were loud when closing, but I never heard anything in the hall or another room. The air handler in our room was loud, but this wasnt a bother, actually helped the baby nap because we forgot to bring a white noise machine. Bed was extremely comfortable and the room had a nice large TV.

Hotel was really nice staff was nice room was nice  the things that we didn’t like was the bed was kinda hard our room was next to a stairwell so my husband had a hard time sleeping and the water in the shower took forever to get hot and I know the front desk told us about the parking ( $10) but when my husband checked his acct it should of been $270 and was charged over $300 and we don’t know why if someone can answer that question that would be helpful thank you
The hotel is lovely.  The only change I would suggest is to have bathroom body wash that is gender neutral.  The products in the bathroom smell very masculine.
Very friendly staff and close to interstate. Everything is close and you're able to walk to shopping and restaurants.
Very Clean. Very Quiet. Lots of stores to shop at and plenty of dinning options. Staff were very friendly and helpful, willing to answer any questions you may have. Rooms were very gorgeous.
Beautiful architectural design and area. Rooms are spacious and easily accessible. Walking distance to food and shopping. Staff is amazing and very friendly!
Muito agradável,  um hotel surpreendente adoramos, muito confortável, voltaremos mais vezes.
Best hotel in that area hands down

Le fait d avoir un bar au 5 ieme étage proche de la chambre horrible du bruit jusqu’à 3 heures du matin difficile de dormir et la femme de chambre à passer à 21:30 pour faire la chambre vraiment déçu sans tout cela sa aurait été formidable
Super expérience! Le seul bémol est le manque de variété des restaurants aux alentours.
Clean new property. Parking was a little inconvenient for dropping off luggage. Room was comfortable. Bed was comfortable

Noisy from 10 pm - 1 am from 
outside loud yelling.

I could hear every door open a close all night.   We were there for a wedding and the bride and groom ordered a room through hotels.com aswell however the artisan gave away their room and denied them any help while they sat their in a wedding dress and tux.  It was a real poor way to treat people
The room was way over priced and the tv was far too big for the distance to the bed.
This hotel is nice cause it is new. It’s cost a night is astronomical for the location
There was alot happing in the area. Restaurants, stores, entertainment, beer garden, pool, hot tub. Would love to go back for a weekend!
Loved everything about The Artisan! Staff, room, restaurant/bars, location! The room was spacious and was furnished so nice.
Bar closes too early on Saturday night
Clean, nicely decorated. Needed bedding for the pull out couch at 1:00 am and got it no problem.
Amazing location with lots of entertainment. The rooms are perfect.
Great place to stay. Good restaurant options with nearby open space to relax with live entertainment.

Room was great; large open room with lots of space so it didn’t feel like you were sleeping in a closet.  
Foyer is beautiful. Rooftop bar was amazing and open late so that was a nice spot to grab a late bite to eat.  I highly recommend ordering the mushroom toast!

Plenty of shopping nearby. 

Overall a nice stay in Salem NH!

This was a nice hotel but we had noise problems both days we were there.  Blaring techno music from a gym across the street from 8 AM to noon on Saturday morning and then we were awoken that night at 2:30 am by loud music that sounded like it was coming from the room next to us.

We recently stayed there for a family wedding.  The hotel is beautiful and the staff couldn't have been more accommodating.  Rooms were so clean and really nice.  The only thing that friends and family complained about was the spin classes going on outside that woke them up. It was a late night and waking up to loud music was not expected. Aside from that it was a perfect place.
Just an ok hotel nothing special

Wonderful stay, as a small business owner, I am very much into detail provided to clients.  The deeper the detail, the bigger the care. I appreciated every detail provided to us in our room. The staff was lovely and helpful.  The process was great.
Nice hotels for a girls getaway

The pool and  hot tub was the best, you could bring a drink out to the pool it was like being on a tropical vacation. Our room was spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious. The hotel in general was beautiful. My only complaint was the young man at the bar that served us and in the morning and older woman who served our latte were a bit miserable. The concierge was extremely pleasant. I will return again but for a longer stay. Overall this hotel was wonderful!! Lots of great stores nearby

The corner lake view room that I paid extra for, over looked the roof of the lower floor, so not as nice as I expected. But overall it was a beautiful hotel. I think they can only charge as much as they do, because it's the only nice hotel in the area. It's more expensive than it should be, but it was a nice stay. I would stay more often if it weren't so expensive.

Everything was fine and the hotel is beautiful. The only downside was the change that they made on my reservation. I reserved a corner room with a lake view and they put us in another room, the reason given was “the room is out of service”.

Hotel is beautiful. Clean, new, elegant. Its pricy for food and drinks - like you would expect for resort style hotel.
Pool is gorgeous. They sometimes have a bracelet policy which can be annoying, but i understand why tgey do it.
Great access to shopping and outdoor social area. 
Very dog friendly area!
Everything was great
The property was clean, well-appointed, and the staff very accommodating.
Amazing
Another great stay

I was woken up in the middle of the night due to a fire alarm. Had to wait out for 30 minutes with no compensation. 
The pool was very overcrowded but became present once the crowd lightened. Lots of food options in the area.
Love this hotel! great location, love the pool and rooftop bar. However, weekends seems to be pretty busy at this hotel with weddings and stuff and check-in may be delayed.
Every body was very nice and accommodating
Clean, easy to park, great location.
Perfect for a weekend stay!
Great design and clean

Check in was excellent (shout out to Yerenia). Rooms were clean, fresh. Pool was very nice. We stayed in even while it rained. Restaurant has some delicious olive oil. Ahi Tuna & Beef Tartare were delicious. Servers were very friendly. Customer service was top tier at all point of contact. Bartender was very cool. Made some nice drinks. My kids absolutely loved their stay. I wish I had more time to explore the neighboring businesses. We were only in town foe the night, but we will definitely return end of August for a longer stay.
I was in love with this place

I booked a 2 night stay at the Artisan hotel at Tuscan Village for a staycation and much needed time off. Check in was a breeze but I was told pool wristbands would be needed for the next day and the rooftop was closed. The next day I came down at about 11am for my passes and immediately felt put off and was asked if I was staying there lol I had my room key card in hand and she asked for my picture ID which is appreciated. She then asked if I was going there right now and how long I’d stay. I responded with I’m not sure I’m heading to grab coffee and a bite next door. 
She (Stephanie) then looked over at Vanessa who’s a manager and said “what is she asking for” extremely unprofessional and annoyed to say the least. I was completely confused at this point, Stephanie came back to explain there’s limited capacity at the pool today dude to the Fourth of July week (lol never heard of this at any resort/hotel ever.) she explained it’s best to return when I’m done getting food and return to grab them as they are doing time slots and condo residents have first choice of the pool lol. I was completely stunned at this point and had no other choice but to agree to come back. I walked out to the parking lot where my car was parked and passed by the pool I was even more surprised to see a handful of people laying out and 1 couple in the pool. I truly felt judged and humiliated. The next day on the fourth I was told by Chris a manager pool is only for residents that day lol complete waste

Overall a great experience minus the staff which they seem nice but are extremely busy all the time which brings their service quality down. Would recommend getting more people at the front desk. Everything else fantastic experience.

It took me about 20 mins to confirm my reservation, then I came back for check in and took an extra 30 mins waiting in line while two staff members without sense of urgency tried to manage 15-20 guests trying to check in, any manager would have solved this issue adding staff members during high volume times. It was crazy to see lack of organization.
Staff really nice. Hotel is very clean, new, beautiful. The pool is awesome.
Great experience! Can’t wait to come back
Beautiful property.  Pleasant and professional staff.
Fyi
Excellent place!!

Would have been 5 stars had the inroom thermostat was able to be set lower then 66 degrees and the tv had the sleep timer work. My over all stay was good and the staff was on point but I have made this complaint to the staff before. Most places allow the ac to be set as low as 62. And being on the top floor with the room at 66 just made sleeping difficult because I kept waking up sweating. It’s pretty bad when the hallway can be set colder then the rooms.
But otherwise the room is VERY clean, the refrigerator is tiny, the beds super comfy along with the pillows. The bathroom is well different but no complaints there other than how freezing cold it gets even when the shower is running. It’s like cold air is pumping in there even when you have the heat on. 
Wish the in room ordering worked, especially for breakfast.
New upcoming area! Lots to do within walking range. Will definitely stay there next time we’re in the area.
Vibrant area surrounding the hotel.  A nice variety of shops and restaurant options.

Great Hotel , friendly staff, spotless , has a restaurant, a cafe and a rooftop bar . Outside pool and hot tub . The village is Amazing , lots of restaurants, bars , live music so much fun . Highly recommended.

If you're with a group and there to drink and party I bet this place is wonderful, but if you want a quiet night with late evening room service then this probably is not the place. I stayed on a Friday evening and was surprised that there was no food on site after 10pm. The parking fee is a joke. Charged $20 ($10 each "day") to self-park in a lot where other retail stores are.
Brand new hotel very clean and modern, whole area is walkable and very vibrant. Great for families.
The moment I got there, I was welcome to. I felt like I was like guest in my in a home in their home. The hospitality was amazing.
Highly recommend

Relaxing by the pool is nonexistent due to the millennial parents drinking alcoholic beverages on one end of the pool while their obnoxious children squirt water guns at anybody and everything at the other side of the pool. On top of that the music is so deafeningly loud that you're guaranteed a migraine before an overpriced sub-par room stay (luxury bathroom includes a square toilet- uncomfortable as hell on my tush, drain in shower was clogged to the point of water overflowing, and towels were sparse).  This stay of course includes a hefty incidental fee that doesn't drop off your credit card bill for 2 weeks. But heck who cares cause you're getting the luxury vibe right?-- Haha! Sleep was also sparse due to tons of in-room after-parties allowing your migraine to continue between the yelling drunks and the consistent slamming of the doors that were even heavier than the ones at Macy's. Even the continuous wafts of pot smoke coming from the halls couldn't help relieve the migraine at 2 a.m. 
So, basically we stayed 1 night and were charged the following:  $252.00 (Discounted 2nd party rate from Expedia),  $20.00 parking fee for two cars, and I was charged $135.00 incidental fee that stayed pending on my  card for 2 weeks. Even though the fee will drop-off in two weeks,  I felt like I'd been jilted paying a total of $410.00 for 1 night in Salem, NH and no breakfast was included. Fabulous, I'll just go spend more money. I've had better stays at Best Western's.   Signed, Broke
Beautiful establishment, love the decor as well as ambience . Very comfortable.  Beautiful area.
The surroundings are great but our room furniture had dust
Best hotel around, Beer Garden and best Italian food literally next door
Es muy bello todo!! Me encantó cada detalle
This is a newer upscale beautiful property.
Amazing bar and center of shopping g, great nightlife!
Fantastic stay.  loved the black out curtains! They really work!   Roof deck bar & Tuscan Kitchen restaurant both did not disappoint!  excellent Bar manager with a very creative cocktail menu!
They did not want use to hang out with kids around the lobby. The kids were calm and had done nothing wrong
Beautiful place to go back in my next visit to Boston

Hotel was EXCELLENT 
PEOPLE AKA STAFF WAS EXCELLENT 
EXCEPT FOR MAID SERVICE , maid took a bag that was not trash , went through it still kept it !! Maids do not speak English, they hide behind that. Bar tenders top shelf !! Food excellent, could use some regular pup food at roof top bar, not everyone want an avocado yak burger with Brussels sprouts. Yuck !!!
Liked the dining and shopping options within walking distance or short drive away.
Great property
We had to stay there during a recent power outage, we were plesantly surprised, the only thing that i would say is the parking is a bit awkward especially for handicapped.
Some minor complication with checking in otherwise, an enjoyable stay
Beautiful place and great staff
Clean and close to all amenities.
Beautiful and plenty to do.
Had a wonderful visit here. The staff was helpful and friendly. Definitely recommend staying here.
Great place, will be back soon!

Excellent location very convenient shops around.
Brand new facilities
Beautiful hotel.  Wish we could have stayed longer to enjoy all of the amenities.   Perfectly clean everywhere.  Spotless.
Great stay-will be back again!
Brand new. Beautiful. Pricey though
Last minute option for my booking and I’m very grateful to of been able to treat myself to an unexpected special occasion and have a hassle free stay for a fair price!
Great looking spot and comfortable
Beautiful hotel in the heart of the Tuscan Village. So much to explore all around the village.
Place was great and clean

To celebrate my birthday weekend, I decided to treat myself to a getaway. And boy, did I make the right choice! This hotel surpassed all my expectations with its fantastic amenities and impeccable cleanliness. The service I received was nothing short of outstanding, making me feel like an honored guest throughout my stay. But the real highlight was the food—absolutely amazing! Every dish was a culinary masterpiece that left my taste buds dancing with delight. Needless to say, I am already planning my next visit to this extraordinary hotel.
Beautiful new hotel
Beautiful hotel . Great to have restaurant on site .
The hotel room was beautiful, modern and well decorated.

One of the cleanest hotels we’ve ever stayed in. Check in was easy and friendly. We asked for a late checkout the morning we were leaving but was denied without an explanation and front desk was a bit rude. All in all a nice stay except for the very end.

Nice hotel. Room was very cozy and comfortable: Only two negatives are 1.) the doors slam hard. So when others left their room it sounded loud in our room. 2.) Parking. The hotel had an event so when we stepped out and came back the guest from the event took all the hotel parking which should only be reserved for paying overnight guest.

Great location, great amenities. 
Truly enjoyed my recent stay. Check in was a breeze. Rooms are new, with comfortable bedding , nice size TV and a desk by a large window area for natural light.
Café downstairs serves great coffee. Area has plenty of shops, restaurants and other amenities. Will definitely be back.
Safety top notch and the restaurants great
Beautiful hotel, spacious, comfortable and very clean. New development offers a lot
Great Hotel, walkable or short drive to plenty of shopping and food. Very clean.

Hotel and surrounding properties were beautiful. However we were kept awake most of the night by loud wedding parties. The following morning I spoke with the front desk who stated they were getting via tent complaints about the walls being so thin and the room loud. The manager stated he would have a gift certificate emailed to me. That never happened.

This hotel was perfectly clean! The grounds were immaculate and it was an easy walk to the Tuscan Village shopping. The ground floor restaurant was beautiful and our server Kayla was amazing!! 10 out of 10
Brand new hotel
Nice rooms, not enough green, too much concrete. No microwave.  PET was additional $150, three times the usual fee. NOT pet friendly.
This is an amazing property!!! Lots of fun food and shopping, great location, friendly staff!!! Can’t wait to go again!!!!
